main event: A round, baseball-sized white object was observed in Yonkers, N. Y. on 6 November 1957. It traveled at a speed of 600-1000 mph, reached 60,000 ft, and was stationary before moving North-South.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a baseball, making it relatively small for an aircraft or known object.
It reached a height of 60,000 ft, which is much higher than a typical commercial or military aircraft in 1957.
The object was observed to move at an incredibly high speed, between 600-1000 mph.
It was stationary for a period before changing direction and moving North-South, indicating advanced flight capabilities.
The report provides a precise date, location, and detailed description of the observed object.
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
